system.biography:
TitleFFF 609-1 Priest Save Knor
Birthday22 Savor 683
AppearanceAge 36, height 5â 11â, heavy frame, weight 182 lb, size 7, average appearance, medium complexion, black hair, hazel eyes
Medical/PsycheEidetic memory
Size7
ArmorAbove average quality embroidered black cloth tunic and leggings, fine embroidered cloth cap, heavy black wool cloak and calf boots; staff and dagger
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, quill & ink
Valuables96d in silver in a money pouch
NotesThe Maecor (Father Visitor) directed that Rodolk should not receive the hexagonal tattoo of a Haliki (priest) when he was promoted from acolyte, to allow him to pass free among the public.

Biography

An inquisitor of the Save Kânorrian Church, Rodolk is tasked with monitoring the location, strength and influence of the dark churches: Agrik, Naveh and Morgath. He travels the island in the guise of a storyteller. His horrific morality tales and frightening ghost stories, combined with a hypnotic and entrancing ability to weave story and act out a tale, draw large crowds despite (or perhaps because of) his sometimes-grim appearance. He dresses all in black; his tunic is embroidered with tales from his stories. Rodolk is well known around the campfires and in the inns of the caravans and market towns.

The clericâs purpose is not to tell stories; it is to g the reaction of the local population. When he recounts a tale of Agrik, do any of the peasants become uncomfortable? When he chronicles the work of a priest of Naveh, does a guildsman begin to fidget nervously? When he describes the torment that awaits the followers of Morgath, does a noble slip away? These are the telltale signs he is looking for. Afterward his stories finished, these are the people he subtly investigates. He misses little.

The son of a longshoreman, Rodolk is far from his humble beginnings. A brilliant mind and iron-will won him entry into the church when many believed his disquieting looks and deep voice would preclude it. His animal magnetism and ability to sniff out dark religions got him transferred to the Rydequelyn when others were only finishing their first Labour of Reverence. His talent for storytelling and eidetic memory carried him quickly up the ranks when many believed he should be hidden in the back room. Rodolk has surprise everyone, except himself.

Considered a leading authority in the dark religions, Rodolk has memorised most of what the Save Kânorrian church knows about them, including a basic ability in the temple tongues of Agrik and Morgath. He has can easily pass as an acolyte or Lay Grandmaster of any of the three churches and has occasionally used this knowledge to infiltrate their ranks and gather intelligence.

Adventure Hooks

Lancing a Boil. Rodolk has uncovered an Agrikan cell in the town. He wants to find out what they are up to and needs assistance. The PCs are just the help he needs.

Unwelcome Notice. A local Navehan fears Rodolk is on to him. He concocts a story that the storyteller is actually an amorvrus and hires the PCs to kill him.

Move Along. The local lord has penetrated Rodolkâs disguise. He has little love for the Rydequelyn, so hires the PCs to rough Rodolk up and send him on his way. The priest suspects the lord is hiding something.
